required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Induction of Labor in Women With Unfavorable Cervix: Dilapan Versus Foley Bulb
clinical_study.official_title: Induction of Labor in Women With Unfavorable Cervix: Randomized Control Study Comparing Dilapan to Foley Bulb

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

brief_summary.textblock: Women undergoing mechanical cervical ripening for labor induction will be randomized to Dilapan-S® versus Foley bulb. The investigators hypothesized that osmotic cervical dilators (Dilapan-S®) are as effective as Foley bulb catheter in rates of vaginal delivery.

detailed_description.textblock: Historically, mechanical methods were the first methods developed to ripen the cervix or to induce labor. Dilapan-S® a synthetic osmotic cervical dilator made of a patented hydrogel (AQUACRYL), works by stimulating the release of endogenous prostaglandins, which degrade collagen fibers and soften the cervix. Additionally, it dilates the cervix gradually and the effect is gentle as well as predictable. Recently, Dilapan-S® has been approved by the FDA as a mechanical dilator for cervical ripening. There are no data comparing this newly approved Dilapan-S® to the Foley catheter, the most commonly used mechanical dilator method. Therefore, The investigators propose a randomized controlled trial to determine the efficacy of Dilapan-S® compared with Foley catheter for cervical ripening before induction of labor in pregnant women greater than 37 weeks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1-2 years
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients that delivered vaginal. (%)

secondary_outcome.description: Delivery time frame in mins from cervical dilator insertion
Rate of vaginal deliveries within 24 hours since admission to hospital (%)
Rate of vaginal deliveries within 36 hours since admission to hospital (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach active stage of labor as ≥ 6cm cervical dilation
secondary_outcome.description: time from hospital admission to reach active stage of labor defined as ≥ 6 cm (mins)
Change in Bishop score from insertion to extraction of device
Proportion of patients that delivered vaginal by forceps assistance or vacuum (%) assistance.
Proportion of patients that delivered by cesarean (%).
Patient satisfaction associated with the device used for cervical ripening (NPS score from patient questionnaire

other_outcome.description: Rate of women who require any analgesia used during insertion of the device
Rate of women underwent spontaneous labor (%)

other_outcome.measure: Pharmacological agents for labor induction (Prostaglandins, Oxytocin)(%)
other_outcome.description: Rate of women that required pharmacological cervical ripening agents (%) requirement (%)
Rate of women that had artificial rupture of membranes (AROM) (%)
Total duration of Dilapan-S® /Foley catheter insertion (mins)
Interval from device placement to delivery (mins)

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of Labor Curves between both interventions
other_outcome.description: Labor curves using Kaplan Meier method comparing Dilapan-S to Foley balloon

Rates of complications resulting from device insertion (%): Vaginal bleeding Vaso-vagal reaction from manipulation of the cervix Cervical laceration Retraction into the uterine cavity Rupture of membranes (Date/Time) Entrapment of the device Fragmentation of the device in the genital tract Rates of complications associated with cervical ripening(%) Uterine tachysystole/hypertonus Non reassuring fetal status Systemic adverse events (nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fever, hypotension, tachycardia)

arm_group.description: Patients will have a Foley catheter inserted into the internal cervical os.
Patients will have Dilapan sticks inserted into the internal cervical os.

intervention.description: Using a sterile speculum, the cervix is visualized and cleaned with iodine. Under direct visualization, synthetic osmotic dilators (Dilapan-S) are inserted into the cervical canal with special attention to cross through the internal os.

Using a sterile speculum, the cervix is visualized and cleaned with iodine. Under direct visualization, a Foley catheter is inserted into the cervix and the balloon is filled with 60 ml of sterile 0.9% NaCl.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant woman scheduled for induction of labor.
- Age between 18 and 45 years.
- Understanding and capable to sign informed consent.
- Singleton pregnancy.
- Gestational age ≥ 37 0/7 weeks.
- Live fetus in cephalic presentation.
- Intact membranes.
- Pelvic exam (sterile vaginal exam) of less than or equal to 3cm and at most 60% effaced.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Iodine allergy.
- Active labor or oxytocin has been administered.
- Chorioamnionitis.
- Prior uterine or cervical surgery.
- Non reassuring fetal status requiring immediate delivery.
- Non-cephalic fetal presentation.
- Active vaginal bleeding from cervical os.
- Placenta previa.
- EFW > 5000 gm(non diabetic) or > 4500gm (diabetic).
- Other contraindication to vaginal delivery.
